DataElement.preferredName: Eflornithine Pills Total First Distribution Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The total number of Eflornithine/placebo pills from the first distribution.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Eflornithine/placebo pills from the first distribution.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A difluoromethylated ornithine compound with antineoplastic activity.  Eflornithine irreversibly inhibits ornithine decarboxylase, an enzyme required for polyamine biosynthesis, thereby inhibiting the formation and proliferation of tumor cells. Polyamines are involved in nucleosome oligomerization and DNA conformation, creating a chromatin environment that stimulates neoplastic transformation of cells. This agent has been shown to induce apoptosis in leiomyoma cells. (NCI04):A dose of medicine in the form of a small pellet.

Concepts.definition: A difluoromethylated ornithine compound with antineoplastic activity.  Eflornithine irreversibly inhibits ornithine decarboxylase, an enzyme required for polyamine biosynthesis, thereby inhibiting the formation and proliferation of tumor cells. Polyamines are involved in nucleosome oligomerization and DNA conformation, creating a chromatin environment that stimulates neoplastic transformation of cells. This agent has been shown to induce apoptosis in leiomyoma cells. (NCI04)
A solid composed of a small, round object composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:The act of distributing or spreading or apportioning.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
The act of distributing or spreading or apportioning.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
